40394954.review:
Take a look at our video review - https://youtu.be/1iQ-cXvgUy8

Steam Curator Group - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/1stgenerationgamingreviews

I like to break my reviews down into a structured format...highligting ten seperate categories.

Below is a brief note with a score for each category.

Graphics - 9                 Fantastic cartoon style
Gameplay - 7               Simple, charming & fun
Value - 8                      Great value for money
Audio - 7                      Nice in-game sounds & soundtrack
Content - 6                  Sufficient content at launch
Potential - 5                Questionable & dependent on extra content in the future
Replayability - 6          Lacks challenges that can affect how much you will keep coming back
Social - 8                     Great game to play with friends
Technical - 9               Very well optimised game
Developers - 7            Milkstone studios seem to be passionate about Farm together

Overall - 72/100
So what do we think of farm together ? Well, the game offers a feel good, visually appealing, casual experience that is great fun to play with friends. A simple pick up and play game that adds a real innocence to the gaming market. Yes, it offers very little in terms of challenges, maybe raising the difficulty level a little would sustain your appeal somewhat but for a budget title you will more than get your monies worth. We feel though, Farm Together is more suited to mobile platforms but that isn't to say it has no place on other other formats. Even after the initial appeal, you will find yourself going back daily to complete your maintenance for half hour for time to come. With the promise of added content on the horizon farm together should hold your interest. For an early access budget title that is well optimised with little bugs to note, we believe this causal fun experience scores a nice 72/100

40386031.review:
Farm Together is exactly what it says it is - a casual farming game designed to be a relaxing timewaster. It's almost like meditation in a video game, something repetitive you can do to reset your stress levels. It feels very similar to a mobile game with the real-time time-gating, but has no in-game microtransactions at all. Whilst early on in the game (the first hour) you might be sitting around waiting for your crops to grow, the game quickly develops into an addictive what's-next game where there is literally not enough time in the day to do everything in your farm. So ultimately, the time factor becomes more of a simple strategy as to what crops to place and where, rather than an actual gate.

[h1]⌛ Play with Time, not with Microtransactions ⌛[/h1]

With no automation (although you can unlock the tractor which farms in blocks of 9 rather than your 1 by hand), by the end of a few hours play I found I had a fully functioning farm with half a dozen crops, 4 different types of trees, chickens, pigs and a selection of buildings. From that point on, there is always something that needs watering or harvesting and I've only unlocked the first tile of many! That's the cycle of the game - you don't want to quit as there's always just one more thing to do, then another, then another, and then another... I would really love to see things like automatic sprinklers for watering, and perhaps even hiring staff to go harvesting for you.

But the farm keeps going whilst you're offline, so the motivation is all in your head and you can spend 5 minutes doing some tasks and then leave it to keep going and when you log on the next day, there'll be tons to do. Bear that in mind if you have an addictive personality and are known to spend too much time gaming (aka, me for sure!) you might find yourself never logging off.

[h1]🐔 Simple, casual concept 🐔[/h1]

This is no Stardew Valley or Farm Simulator and it doesn't want to be. It's a basic concept designed for people who just want to create a farm without having to think too much about it. This is farming at it's most simplest. Plant, water, harvest. Upgrade. Plant, water, harvest. There are a few nice customization options in between, with cosmetic buildings, items, fences and paths, so if you like making a pretty farm there are some options there.

[h1]🍆 Accessible co-op 🍆 [/h1]

I forced my husband to play with me for a few hours (he hates this type of game so bribery was involved) to test out the co-op and it works reasonably well. You can jump in and out of other players games, and they can change their settings to allow people to just farm or have higher modification permissions. It does need some work, as right now you can only change friends or not friends. I have 300 steam friends and I only want to give my husband permissions, but this doesn't seem to be settable on a personal basis. Additionally, the farm is hosted locally and as such if your friend isn't online, you can't contribute to their farm, so you can't truly have a co-op farm that's run by multiple people. The host would have to leave their PC and game running 24-7 to allow for a truly multiplayer farm. Still, what's there is very easy to use, intuitive, functional and fun (if you enjoy this sort of game). 

I think it would make a great family game, with a parent hosting and everyone helping out and it should run on even a potato machine.

 My husbands verdict: Addictive, but pointless. He also said "Why did you make me play this and when do I get my <redacted> as payment?"  So, definitely not for everyone. 

 My verdict: A relaxing one-cost alternative to the casual mobile / Facebook farming genre. 

[h1]🍌 A good start. If you like this sort of game 🍌[/h1]

It's all rather basic right now but it's a solid early access foundation for what seems to be a well thought out and very cute casual farming game. If this is your style of game you will know it from the store video and screenshots. Looking forward to seeing how this evolves with time. But even in these early stages, it's a thumbs up from me. Now, time to go harvest some grapes.. 🍇 🍇

💖 If you find the reviews of an old Welsh lady interesting, please follow  [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28971565/]My Curator Page[/url] 💖

40378510.review:
I discovered this game in the "Hidden Gems" section of Steam250. Interesting, I somehow missed it in my "exploration queue" even though I check that every day.

Finally, here's a casual farming type game I can easily recommend. After installing this I couldn't pull myself away until 4 hours later when it was almost midnight. I played this with a friend and we just had a good ole time running around planting, harvesting, and unlocking new things.

Some items you plant are harvestable rather quickly, while others can take multiple real-life days before they can be havested. This is definitely a game you'd want to fire up, piddle around in, and then come back to later... casual. But no "pay money to harvest immediately" kind of BS.

The animations, the graphics, the sound, the overall presentation, it's very smooth and polished. I played with a gamepad and it was great. I finally found the perfect game to jump into when you don't really feel like blowing stuff up or getting stomped, and you don't know how much time you'll have to dedicate. It has a very intuitive UX, and an easy learning curve. It's a peaceful, relaxing experience, just like it says on the box.

I think between this and My Time at Portia, we have a couple of really charming little games you can get lost in for a while. I recorded a bunch of footage, so once I get it edited and posted, I'll update this review.

40354710.review:
Wie jedes Farming Spiel macht es unglaublich süchtig, ist aber auch mit viel Liebe zum Detail designt. Man bekommt ein riesiges Stück Land, legt Felder an, erntet Obstbäume und verdient sich so bares Geld. Dieses kann man dann mit immer höherem Level in Tiere und neue Pflanzen investieren. Die Quests sind recht lang angelegt (Bsp.: erste Aufgabe 110x Salat ernten) aber nie frustrierend oder unangemessen. Höchstens das Fischen, da man nicht immer etwas fängt, aber ein bisschen Realismus ist ja auch mal ganz schön in einem Spiel, in dem die Äpfel fast so groß sind wie man selbst :D :D Die Grafik und Animation sind insgesamt wirklich ansprechend gestaltet und die Musik auch einfach toll. Neben den Hauptquests kann man an Verkaufsständen immer seine Sachen in Bündeln verkaufen zB. 10x Obst oder 20x Gemüse und so Diamanten erhalten. Mit denen kann man sich anfangs rein kosmetische Dinge wie Heuballen, Futternäpfe, Winrad, Lagerfeuer etc kaufen, später dann auch Landerweiterungen. Aber Platzmangel herrscht eigentlich nie, ganz im Gegenteil!! Da alles frei bewegbar ist, kann man sich kreativ austoben und die Farm gestalten wie man möchte. Die Busstation auf dem eigenen Grundstück ermöglicht anderen Spielern, mal vorbeizuschauen und bei der Ernte zu helfen. Wenn ihr wollt, könnt ihr auch einstellen, dass Gäste ebenfalls pflanzen können. Über einen Chat (auch per Voice) kann man die Arbeit besprechen.

Lange Rede kurzer Sinn: vor der Veröffentlichung hatte ich mit einem deutlich höheren Preis gerechnet und kann nur sagen, dass 15€ für ein dermaßen schönes und unterhaltsames Spiel absolut fair sind!

PS: Fast hätte ich den Traktor vergessen. Mit dem bewirtschaftet man bequem ohne abzusteigen 3x3 Felder inklusive hacken, säen, wässern und ernten. Für das Benzin geht wohl das meiste Geld drauf, aber es lohnt sich :)

40322951.review:
It's a mobile-game-like. If anyone love to spend time waiting for crop to grow, then this is your game. But if not, don't buy it.

pro
1. graphic - it's good, nothing to comment here.
2. music - you can listen to it without getting annoyed.
3. control - easy enough for children to understand.
4. customizable character - not much to customize but still good that it can be customize.
5. customizable farm - as long as you don't mind how you have to spend on waiting your crops to grow, you can customize your farm.
6. bring friend to help on your farm

con
1. unlock item with level - I spend 43 minute to unlock level 2 item.
2. some crop use 10-15 hours to grow - and it's not game time.

I will request for refund because I don't like mobile-game-like element. Still I'm not going to give thumb down on this one. It's a good game as long as you can accept that it's a mobile-game-like.

40319948.review:
A new farming game in its earliest stages. I have only managed to play like an hour of it. I will update the review the game as I play and unlock more stuff.

Pros:
- Easy tutorial to start off.
- Good graphics.
- Good music.
- Farming is pretty easy.
- Harvest times vary depending on crops/trees.
- Tractor fuel does not cost money.
- The game time goes on even if you log off, so crops can grow overnight.

Cons:
- No tutorial on how to get diamonds, luckily I managed to find out fast.
- Recycle and relocate key binding are too close to each other by default (keys can be re-bound).
- Cannot rotate builds using key bindings.

Keeping in mind that the game just came out and is in early access, the one hour that I have played the game, I have enjoyed it and will recommend getting the game highly. I will have to try multiplayer and co-op once more friends get the game.

40319355.review:
The Devs did a wonderful job on this game.  The graphics are great, I love the animations!  It has a Farmville feel to it but with its own special uniqueness. Its a very relaxed game, if your crops say they take a day to grow, they really take a day to grow. The nice thing though is that, unlike Farmville, when you water your crops in this game it speeds up the growth timer, which is an aspect I personally like! I looove the tractor!  It makes it easier to farm and get around your land.

So, I just have one con, and thats the tutorial.  It would have been nice to have a separte map for the tutorial that included everrything you can do in the game. In my opion, a tutorial is suppose to teach you what you need to do and how to do it in a quick manner.  For example, the crops, during the tutorial they are kept at the same growth time.  Because of this, I was waiting, and waiting not nowing what to do next.  It would have been nice to have them set to only seconds during the tutorial to make the walkthrough of what to do and how to do it quicker.

In conclusion, if you are a Farmville lover this is the game for you.  I love farm simulation games, and this one is pretty good for only being in Early Access.  I would recommend getting it, it is a lot of fun once you get pass the tutorial. 

Great Job Devs! Keep up the good work!

40315311.review:
I've been waiting for a follow up to Avatar Farm Online and they finally came out with it. I tweeted them a couple weeks ago and found out they were getting ready to come out with this. My wife and I logged many hours into Avatar Farm Online on Xbox 360. This game is a very worthy follow up and if you ever played AFO, this game is great.

The graphics are a lot prettier, it runs so much more smoothly, it's just mindless fun that requires no thinking. As of right now there is no story or plot or anything, it's mostly just meant for relaxing and farming. The music is very nice. My only complaint would be maybe some more customization of your farmer. Other than that, if you're looking for a game where you don't have to think, this would be it.

Edit: Also, the game is completely microtransaction free. Something that many farm games lack.

40314266.review: Tengo un I7 con grafica nvidia 1070 y me pone la GPU a mas del 90% y da igual si le pones calidad a tope o minimo
40314266.developer_response:
Hola, si quieres evitar que la GPU se caliente (con este y otros juegos), evita que funcione al 100% constantemente activando el VSync. También ten cuidado con el parámetro "Escala de renderizado", ya que a más del 100% hará un supersampling bastante costoso que probablemente baje el framerate y fuerce la GPU.

Ten en cuenta que este juego consume bastante poca CPU, por lo que si se le da rienda suelta, la GPU tirará a todo lo que pueda.

Si quieres aportar más datos por favor postea en el foro para que podemos echarle un vistazo.

40311575.review:
This is a very niche kinda game. It's a casual farming sim not unlike what you'd probably find in a mobile game, but the difference here is it has a fair bussiness model; no microtransactions. You buy the game and that's it, everything in it's unlocked through in-game progression. Another difference is that this game's actually quite pretty, despite being tile-based it doesn't look too artificial, and you can make some pretty nice looking stuff.

The multiplayer aspect's pretty nifty, while playing i had a couple people drop by just to help water and harvest some stuff. I'm curious what a farm where everyone's allowed to do anything would end up looking like.

As far as the price, i can't say yet, I can see myself getting quite a bit of time outta this but i think it's too early to come to a conclusion yet. But if this game seems like something you'd be interested in then i think it's worth giving it a shot.

40308516.review:
For too long, the gaming industry has ceded the casual farming game market to in-game-transaction obsessed flash games (*cough*Farmville*cough*). Farm Together helps to rectify that error by giving us the cute, cooperative, casual farming gameplay we crave, but as a proper desktop game with a single, fixed purchase price.

For my fellow Penguinistas: uses Unity3D, runs beautifully on my Mint 18.3, with only the minor twitch of Unity3d's windowed-at-full-screen-res bug.

Pros:

[list]
 [*]both single player and online multiplayer modes
 [*]cooperative multiplayer
 [*]weather
 [*]day/night cycles
 [*]customizable avatar
 [*]decorations
 [*]bus stops! (what can I say, I'm a transit geek)
 [*]full 3d
[/list]

Cons:

[list]
 [*]tractor (this probably doesn't bother most people, it's just not my thing)
 [*][strike]recycle shortcut needs moving or a confirmation screen[/strike] fixed!
[/list]
